user_query: move the three-dimensional cube to another axis. It looks like there is a small cube in the cube. But to be clear, it's just an optical illusion, and it's just a hexahedron moving into one axis. Of course, I did find the best angle to look like that. But if you add a little explanation, you can call it a four-dimensional hypercube that has a small cube inside a big cube. This is called Tesseract. I'll leave a detailed story about the four-dimensional hypercube as follows. According to the rules of the dimension we saw earlier, there must be eight hexahedrons at the boundary of the tesseract. It would be fun to stop the video for a while and look for 8 hexahedrons. Did you find all eight hexahedrons? If you break up the Tesseract, you'll see eight hexahedrons. Let's go back to Interstellar's Cube. Cooper is a three-dimensional existence, so if it falls into a four-dimensional tesseract, it must exist only in one of the eight hexahedrons. Cooper can observe the Murph in six different ways, even with a slight turn. Just like this scene right now. This scene shows Cooper turning around and looking at the Murph in the F direction. In the movie, we simply expressed the object by removing the middle cube that we had to pass through. Cooper's three-dimensional space is attached with six spatial orientations with a view of the Murph. Then again, we arrange Murph's room on two time axes. This scene shows only a part of the room, but there are scenes that show a full room in the movie.

entities.entity_description: 테서랙트는 4차원 하이퍼큐브로, 큰 큐브 안에 작은 큐브가 있는 구조이며 경계에 8개의 육면체가 존재한다
쿠퍼는 3차원 존재로서 4차원 테서랙트에 떨어지면 8개의 육면체 중 하나에만 존재해야 하며, 약간의 회전만으로도 6가지 다른 방향에서 머프를 관찰할 수 있다
머프는 쿠퍼가 테서랙트 안에서 관찰하는 대상이며, 그녀의 방은 두 개의 시간 축에 배열되어 있다

relationships.relationship_description: 쿠퍼는 인터스텔라의 주인공으로 4차원 테서랙트 큐브에 들어간다
머프는 인터스텔라에 등장하는 캐릭터로 쿠퍼가 테서랙트에서 관찰하는 인물이다
쿠퍼는 테서랙트 안에서 머프를 6가지 다른 방향으로 관찰하며, 머프의 방을 바라본다
쿠퍼는 3차원 존재로서 4차원 테서랙트 안에 떨어져 그 안에서 활동한다
